annonstext:
At Tetra Pak we touch millions of lives every day, ensuring better nutrition and healthier lifestyles through safe packaging and food processing solutions. Guided by our global brand promise, PROTECTS WHAT´S GOOD, we strive to make a difference by protecting food, people and our futures. To do this we need more than smart technology. We need smart people too. People like you, who wants to work with people like us.

Straws organization within Supply Chain Operations, Additional Materials is managing the sourcing, production and supply of Straws for the application on Tetra Pak packages worldwide.

In this central role as a Mechanical Expert, you will support overall reliability of equipment from mechanical side, by managing maintenance program and support product life cycle activities. You will also be responsible for supporting factories remotely or onsite for machine troubleshooting, root cause analysis and effective countermeasure. 

This position is based in Lund, Sweden. 

 

What you will do

	Manage and control Documentation i.e. Mechanical Drawings, BOM, Spare parts list, Equipment tree, Operational and Maintenance Manuals, SOPs for standard lines.
	Provide and secure input to technical documentation and manuals.
	Support process of Continuous improvement (MP System) being part of improvement approval phase, and then to support factories in design improvements and feeding back the changes to Documentation.
	Drive innovation to improve quality, safety, reliability and energy consumption.
	Manage central projects related to machine improvements and standardization.
	Support cost calculations and evaluation of technical solutions.
	The position requires seamless and transparent cooperation with central/clusters/business units etc.

Who you are

We believe you are a person with good communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others at different levels of the organization. You have experience of working with teams to drive continuous initiatives and are self-driven with a pro-active approach. You possess strong analytical and logical skills and have knowledge of predictive maintenance concepts. You have the ability to motivate and engage your colleagues. 

We believe you have: 

	Minimum B.Sc./B.Eng. level degree in the field of Mechanical or Mechatronics.
	Minimum 5 years of experience as machine designer or as maintenance engineer in the production environment, preferably in the food packaging/processing industry.
	Work experience needed of Creo and PDM Link and AutoCAD/Inventor experience is an added advantage.
	Work experience in WCM/TPM environment is required. 
	Solid knowledge of functional safety, quality and mechanical design standards is needed.
	MS Office literacy is required.
	Fluent in English, both written and verbally is a must.

We offer you

	Variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
	Culture that pioneers spirit of innovation where our engineering genius drives visible result
	Equal opportunity employment experience that values difference and diversity
	Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

Apply now!

If you are inspired to share our responsibility of protecting food to protecting the planet, apply through our careers page on jobs.tetrapak.com/. 

This job posting expires on 2021-03-26
